required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the OEC Elite Vascular Mobile Fluoroscopy System
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the OEC Elite Vascular Mobile Fluoroscopy System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to collect survey data on the use of the OEC Elite Mobile Fluoroscopy System based on the routine clinical use of the device.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective clinical study is being conducted to acquire image guidance adequacy data from physicians conducting clinically-indicated vascular, gastrointestinal (GI), urology and pain management procedures for engineering use, as deemed appropriate by the Sponsor, for the investigational OEC Elite Mobile Fluoroscopy System (OEC Elite) in the vascular configuration. Clinical procedures included in this study will involve three (3) anatomical regions of interest - extremities and neck, thorax, and abdomen and pelvis. These regions are being targeted because they represent the range of clinical applications and anatomical regions intended for OEC Elite in the vascular configuration.

primary_outcome.measure: Imaging Guidance Adequacy Assessed by Number of Questionnaires
primary_outcome.description: Per-subject investigator report for procedure completion using the Investigational Device

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Investigator Procedure Surveys Assessed by Survey Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of per subject survey completion reflecting the investigator opinion of procedures completed with the investigational device

arm_group.description: Vascular, gastrointestinal (GI), urology or pain management procedures for which use of the OEC Elite system

intervention.description: Adults undergoing vascular, gastrointestinal (GI), urology or pain management procedures

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
